page.title: 05Scotter's New Village Hall
page.content: The hall was officially opened by the{ {Duchess of Gloucester}on 12.7.85.This was the first royal visit since{King {John}visited the village in 1216. The decision to build a new hall was taken at a public meeting in Jan.1977. The existing facilities were thought to be inadequate due to population growth.A site on the playing field was chosen as this could be leased for{Â£1} per annum.The hall was financed partly by grant aid and partly by money raised in various ways by the{village {hall committee}.The most unusual of these was to entertain a party of{ {American tourists}in the village in the summer of '85.Building was begun in March 1982 by the{Manpower Services {Commission}.Local volunteers have helped with the interior decoration. The hall,an imposing brick building,is the result of many years fund raising.
